Name: Hokkaido
Description: The northernmost island of Japan, known for its cold winters, skiing resorts, and natural beauty.

Name: Tohoku
Description: A region in the northeastern part of Japan, known for its mountains, hot springs, and rural landscapes.

Name: Kanto
Description: The region around Tokyo, the economic and political center of Japan, including Kanagawa, Chiba, and Saitama.

Name: Chubu
Description: Central Japan, known for its mountains, lakes, and the city of Nagoya, a hub for Japan s automotive industry.

Name: Kinki (Kansai)
Description: A region in the western part of Japan, including cities like Osaka, Kyoto, and Kobe, known for its culture and history.

Name: Chugoku
Description: A region in the western part of Japan, known for its scenic beauty, including the island of Miyajima and historical sites.

Name: Shikoku
Description: The smallest of Japan s four main islands, known for its temples, mountains, and rural landscapes.

Name: Kyushu
Description: The southernmost main island of Japan, known for its active volcanoes, hot springs, and historical cities like Nagasaki.

Name: Okinawa
Description: A group of islands in the southernmost part of Japan, known for their tropical climate, beaches, and distinct culture.
